SpLibraryFolder.title: Examples of science programs generated using the OT

SpNote.note: 1. make SCUBA noise measurements and perform skydip 2. point/focus/align instruemnt and telescope 3. make calibration measurement as appropriate 4. make pointing and choose quasar target

This observation provides an example of calibration at 850um/450um of the photometry observing mode. Here, the choice of calibration source and precise scheduling of the calibration observation is left to the discretion of the observer/TSS. ( An example of a calibration observation where a specific calibration target is required is given in ***).
The following parameters have been set for the calibration observation:
- bolometers to be calibrated are H7 (long: 850W) and C14 (short: 450W) (set in the SCUBA icon)
- a chop throw of 60" in azimuth (set in CHOP sequence)
- 6 integrations (set in the PHOTOMETRY eye)
A pointing will be made prior to the calibration observation (POINTING eye), as will a skydip (SKYDIP eye).
SpNote.title: Observation notes

SpNote.note: This observation is an example of the sequence of tasks required to make an 850/450um photometry observation.
SpNote.title: Observation notes

SpNote.note:
This observation provides an example of calibration at 850/450um of the photometry observing mode. Here, the choice of calibration source and precise scheduling of the calibration observation is left to the discretion of the observer/TSS.
A number of parameters have been assumed/predetermined, as listed below:
- the bolometers to be calibrated have been set to H7 on the LONG array and C14 on the SHORT array, with the 850W/450W um filter wheel setting selected.
- a chop throw of 60" in azimuth (set in CHOP sequence)
- 6 integrations (set in the JIGGLE eye)
A pointing and focus will be made prior to the calibration observation (POINTING and FOCUS eyes respectively), as will a skydip (SKYDIP eye). The actual sequence will be determined at the time of observing by the TSS/observer, depending on when the last FOCUS/SKYDIPs were made.
SpNote.title: Observation notes

SpNote.note:
This observation provides an example of calibration at 750/350um of the photometry observing mode. Here, the choice of calibration source and precise scheduling of the calibration observation is left to the discretion of the observer/TSS.
A number of parameters have been assumed/predetermined, as listed below:
- the bolometers to be calibrated have been set to H7 on the LONG array and C14 on the SHORT array, with the 750W/350W um filter wheel setting selected.
- a chop throw of 60" in azimuth (set in CHOP sequence)
- 6 integrations (set in the PHOTOMETRY eye)
A pointing and focus will be made prior to the calibration observation (POINTING and FOCUS eyes respectively), as will a skydip (SKYDIP eye). The actual sequence will be determined at the time of observing by the TSS/observer, depending on when the last focus/SKYDIPs were made.
SpNote.title: Observation notes

SpNote.note:
This observation provides an example of calibration at 2000 um of the photometry observing mode. Here, the choice of calibration source and precise scheduling of the calibration observation is left to the discretion of the observer/TSS.
A number of parameters have been assumed/predetermined, as listed below:
- the bolometer to be calibrated is the 2000 um pixel.
- a chop throw of 60" in azimuth (set in CHOP sequence)
- 6 integrations (set in the PHOTOMETRY eye)
A pointing and focus will be made prior to the calibration observation (POINTING and FOCUS eyes respectively), as will a skydip (SKYDIP eye). The actual sequence will be determined at the time of observing by the TSS/observer, depending on when the last focus/SKYDIPs were made.
SpNote.title: Observation notes

SpNote.note:
This observation provides an example of calibration at 1350 um of the photometry observing mode. Here, the choice of calibration source and precise scheduling of the calibration observation is left to the discretion of the observer/TSS.
A number of parameters have been assumed/predetermined, as listed below:
- the bolometer to be calibrated is the 1350 um pixel.
- a chop throw of 60" in azimuth (set in CHOP sequence)
- 6 integrations (set in the PHOTOMETRY eye)
A pointing and focus will be made prior to the calibration observation (POINTING and FOCUS eyes respectively), as will a skydip (SKYDIP eye). The actual sequence will be determined at the time of observing by the TSS/observer, depending on when the last focus/SKYDIPs were made.
SpNote.title: Observation notes

SpNote.note:
This observation provides an example of calibration at 1100 um of the photometry observing mode. Here, the choice of calibration source and precise scheduling of the calibration observation is left to the discretion of the observer/TSS.
A number of parameters have been assumed/predetermined, as listed below:
- the bolometer to be calibrated is the 1100 um pixel.
- a chop throw of 60" in azimuth (set in CHOP sequence)
- 6 integrations (set in the PHOTOMETRY eye)
A pointing and focus will be made prior to the calibration observation (POINTING and FOCUS eyes respectively), as will a skydip (SKYDIP eye). The actual sequence will be determined at the time of observing by the TSS/observer, depending on when the last focus/SKYDIPs were made.
SpNote.title: Observation notes

SpNote.note:
This observation provides an example of calibration of the jiggle map observing mode. Here, the choice of calibration source and precise scheduling of the calibration observation is left to the discretion of the observer/TSS. Data from both the LONG and SHORT arrays will be stored, with the 850W/450W um filter selected. A 64-position jiggle pattern will be employed to obtain a fully sampled map at both LONG and SHORT wavelengths.
A number of parameters have been assumed/predetermined, as listed below:
- maps map with both arrays will be fully sampled
- a chop throw of 60" in azimuth (set in CHOP sequence)
- 2 integrations (set in the JIGGLE eye)
A pointing and focus will be made prior to the calibration observation (POINTING and FOCUS eyes respectively), as will a skydip (SKYDIP eye). The actual sequence will be determined at the time of observing by the TSS/observer, depending on when the last focus/SKYDIPs were made.
SpNote.title: Observation notes

SpNote.note:
This observation provides an example of calibration of the jiggle map observing mode. Here, the choice of calibration source and precise scheduling of the calibration observation is left to the discretion of the observer/TSS. Data from both the LONG and SHORT arrays will be stored, with the 850W/450W um filter selected. A 16-position jiggle pattern will be employed, so ONLY data taken with the SHORT array will be fully sampled.
A number of parameters have been assumed/predetermined, as listed below:
- only the map taken with the SHORT array will be fully sampled
- a chop throw of 60" in azimuth (set in CHOP sequence)
- 2 integrations (set in the JIGGLE eye)
A pointing and focus will be made prior to the calibration observation (POINTING and FOCUS eyes respectively), as will a skydip (SKYDIP eye). The actual sequence will be determined at the time of observing by the TSS/observer, depending on when the last focus/SKYDIPs were made.
SpNote.title: Observation notes

SpNote.note:
This observation provides an example of calibration of the jiggle map observing mode. Here, the choice of calibration source and precise scheduling of the calibration observation is left to the discretion of the observer/TSS. Data from both the LONG and SHORT arrays will be stored, with the 850W/450W um filter selected. A 16-position jiggle pattern will be employed, so ONLY data taken with the LONG array will be fully sampled.
A number of parameters have been assumed/predetermined, as listed below:
- only the map taken with the LONG array will be fully sampled
- a chop throw of 60" in azimuth (set in CHOP sequence)
- 2 integrations (set in the JIGGLE eye)
A pointing and focus will be made prior to the calibration observation (POINTING and FOCUS eyes respectively), as will a skydip (SKYDIP eye). The actual sequence will be determined at the time of observing by the TSS/observer, depending on when the last focus/SKYDIPs were made.
SpNote.title: Observation notes
